abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated highly
            satisfactory while project sustainability is adjudged highly
            likely. Both World Bank and Borrower performances are rated
            highly satisfactory. Lessons learned include the following:
            The operation provides a good example of successful
            coordination between privately-owned consumer cooperatives
            (PBSs) and a government oversight/quasi-regulatory
            institution (REB). The system has now gained considerable
            maturity which is demonstrated by the ability to replicate
            new cooperatives and find capable staff in rural areas to
            man technical and management functions. The ability to
            mobilize these cooperatives to take over comparatively large
            networks previously managed by and deal with consumers used
            to fraudulent practices speaks highly of the sustainability
            of the system. Another lesson to be learned is the
            importance of training rural technicians (wiremen, linesmen,
            etc.) to strengthen the rural private sector to sustain
            private sector led construction work and to help in widening
            the consumer base. Major lessons could also be learnt from
            the loss reduction, rehabilitation, and regularization
            exercise underway in the taken-over area. However, it will
            be some time before the final results could be made known
            and conclusions drawn on the success of various alternatives
            being followed by different PBSs.
